extendedInfo.description: Ever wanted to set up a tournament with your friends but can never decide how to schedule the matches?  Quick Tournament Maker strives to take away the hassle of deciding by creating the schedule for you, whether by Elimination (AKA Brackets), Double Elimination or Round Robin. Features:1)Quick StartUse numbers to reference each player or team for your tournaments.  This will save time by skipping the task of adding every player (or team) name into the database. 2) Full StartUse inputted names for your tournaments.  This will save you the hassle of reassigning numbers and remembering who they reference.3) Elimination (Bracket)Also known as bracket style tournament, each player or team will be pitted against another.  The winners of that round will face each other etc. until a winner emerges.  When the number of players (or teams) is odd or not a power of 2, an empty slot will occur (AKA "Bye") where the other player or team will automatically be the winner.4) Double EliminationSimilar to "Elimination" except a player or team has to lose twice to be eliminated.  One loss will result in getting moved into the loser bracket to go against other losers.  In the end, the winner of the "Winner Bracket" and the winner of the "Loser Bracket" will face off in the "Final Bracket".5) Round RobinEach player or team will take turn facing each other exactly once.  An empty slot (AKA "Bye") will be used if there are an odd number of players or teams.  You can decide whether he, she or they who faces the "Bye"; should get a win or not.                6) SurvivalFor each round, a certain number of players/teams will be deemed winners and the rest will be losers.  The winners will progress to the next round and so forth until there are no more rounds left.  Similar to the format of American Idol or Hell's Kitchen.7) Save and Load previous tournamentsYou can also save and reload your tournaments whenever you want. The custom tournament title, number of players and most recent time you saved will be recorded------------------Please add "Quick Tournament Maker: " at the beginning of your subject line when emailing me.  Please also report bugs through emails so that we may converse in more details.

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.comment: Need to be able to pair contacts into teams please. Otherwise pretty solid
reviews.author: Ricky Chun

reviews.comment: Needs round robin to add cumulative score for each team. Otherwise, 100% what I\'m looking for...
reviews.author: matt nimbler

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Great app, but when are you going to put up to 64 teams in a tournament?
reviews.author: Blake McCormick

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment: Not sure if it has the function to view an active league table in roubd robin mode. Really needs one
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works Great
reviews.comment: Good at making tournaments. Too good.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good, not great
reviews.comment: Good app, helps coordinate tournaments via tablet at work. Would have rated higher if app didn\'t crash occasionally.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: The Best yet!
reviews.comment: I use this on my Nexus Android tablet. It\'s really well done . You can save and print your brackets. You can save and maintain a list of participants. You can select individuals from the list. The application seems very stable and reliable. Keep up the good work!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Lack an option to withdraw an player. Like when a player gets hurt or MUST leave,
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Terrific app!
reviews.comment: Just add option to input scores and it is perfect!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Really hard to navigate.
reviews.comment: It\'s really difficult to see where you are in the bracket. App needs a zoom in-and-out feature badly, because you can never see the entire bracket. Also, the losers side needs to propagate to the left, like any normal double-elimination bracket. A nice feature to add would be if you could input names of players and have the app draw them into teams (2-person, 3-person, etc) This is the best tournament bracket out there that I could find, but it needs a lot of work still.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app. Useful when ppl are over for video game
reviews.comment: Great app. Useful when ppl are over for video games or basketball. Works as advertised, no problems so far. Thanks.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Looks good! Great for my pool tournaments. I especially like the layout of the tournament style.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great App!
reviews.comment: Very useful and simplified my life as a coach.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Unstable!
reviews.comment: The dang thing keeps crashing on me after loading a saves tournament.
reviews.author: Dj Say
